column4: I'm trying to get LAN network working between my Win7 and my Ubuntu, I have got smbfs, but the computers only find each other through wireless, why?
have you tried a ping in both ways?
how do I check the ipaddress on ubuntu, like ipconfig on windows?
open a terminal. Type "sudo ifconfig"
ok, eth0 shows some stuff, but I noticed only IPvP6 is there not IPvP4...
there is no entry in the inet Adress Part of the ifconfig output?
there's inet6
then you have to set a IP Adress yourself: "ifconfig eth0 ip.ip.ip.ip mask mask.mask.mask"
it said "SIOCSIFADDR_ Invalid argument"
replace _ with :
what was the command you entered? You have to run it as root or with sudo
sudo ifconfig eth0 192.168.0.99 mask 255.255.255.0
now it says "mask: Unknown host"
sorry netmask not mask :)
still only inet6
can you pastebin the output of ifconfig?
no :S my linux has no internet
ok but the ifconfig eth0 command was successfull? No Error messages?
aha! now I fixed it
Great :) What was the problem?
so now ifconfig shows inet, but I still don't find the Win7 computer on the network...
oh wait, I did :D
:) great. if you want to save the configuration permanently you have to edit /etc/network/interfaces. Here is doc: http://www.ubuntugeek.com/ubuntu-networking-configuration-using-command-line.html
